document.topic_text: FRI., AUG. 12 Document Shredding 1 to 4 p.m. in front parking lot of Simi Valley Chamber of Commerce, 40 W. Cochran St. Charge: $5 per 12-by-15-inch box. Contact: Chamber. Phone: 805.526. 3900. Movie In The Park 7 p.m. at Community Center Park,1605 E. Burnley St., Camarillo. Outdoor screening of “Toy Story” (G) at dusk. Family-style games before movie. Bring blanket or low chair and picnic. Free admission. Phone: 805.482.1996. Web: www.pvrpd.org . Second Friday Dance 7:30 to 10 p.m. at Simi Valley Senior Center, 3900 Avenida Simi. John Brunac Duo performs. Hawaiian theme. Dance hosts & hostesses, door prizes, refreshments. Hustle dance lesson from 6:30 to 7:30 p.m. Admission: $7. Phone: 805.583.6363. SAT. AUG. 13 Indoor Parking Lot Sale 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. at St. Julie Billiart parish hall, 2475 Borchard Road, Newbury Park. Also 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. Sunday. Early entry for seniors and disabled 4:30 to 6 p.m. Fri., Aug. 12. Benefit for Helping Hands Ministry. Phone: 805.498.7377. Conejo Valley Writers Noon to 2:30 p.m. at Goebel Adult Community Center, Foothill Lupin Room, 1385 E. Janss Road, Thousand Oaks. Optional BYO brown-bag lunch at noon. Activities 12:30 p.m. Manuscript critique, Q&A . Web: www.meetup.com/Conejo-ValleyWriters . Bichon Frise Bash Noon at home of Janice Smets, Oak Park. Lunch at noon, speaker at 1 p.m. Professional dog trainer Kim Rinehardt shares insights on dog behavior. Dogs welcome; secure yard for dog play. RSVP required. Contact: Myrna Baum. Phone: 805. 306.9516. Movie In The Park 6 p.m. at Rancho Simi Community Park, 1765 Royal Ave., Simi Valley. Activities 6 p.m. “Hotel Transylvania 2” outdoor screening begins at dusk. Concessions for sale. Free admission. Contact: Danielle June. Phone: 805.584.4443. Email: . Web: www.rsrpd.org . ‘Les Miserables’ 7:30 p.m. at performing arts education center, Calabasas High School, 22855 W. Mulholland Hwy. Also 2 p.m. Sun., Aug. 14. MET2 Teen Company presents musical. Call for ticket prices. Phone: 818.892.2959. Happy Squares Club Square Dance 8 to 10:30 p.m. at Simi Valley Senior Center, 3900 Avenida Simi. Rounds start 7:15 p.m. Hunter Keller, caller. Casual attire. Refreshments. Admission: $7. Phone: 805.522.1455. Web: www.happysquares.com . SUN., AUG. 14 Simi Valley Jazz/Dance Club 1 to 4:30 p.m. at Simi Valley Senior Center, 3900 Avenida Simi. Free dance lesson at 12:30 p.m. Jamming from 1 to 3 p.m. Groovin’ Easy Big Band plays 3:15. Dance floor, refreshments. $7 members, $10 nonmembers. Phone: 805.279.3905. Old Time Fiddlers 1:30 to 4:30 p.m. at Oak View Community Center, 18 Valley Road. Play, listen or dance to country western and bluegrass music. Free admission. Phone: 805.797.6563. Web: calfiddlers.com. Food Truck Meet-Up 3 to 7 p.m. at JV baseball field, Moorpark High School, 4500 Tierra Rejada Road. 10 food trucks, live band, rock climbing, dunk booth, jumbo slide, silent auction, drawing. Youth singers perform. Free admission. Funds support Moorpark Education Foundation and local school programs. Web: www.moorparkedfoundation.org . Gardens Of the World Concert 5 to 6:30 p.m. at Gardens of the World, 2001 E. Thousand Oaks Blvd., T.O. Guitarist Carl Verheyen, formerly of Supertramp, performs. Bring lawn seating and picnic. No smoking, glass containers, alcohol or pets. Free admission. No on-site parking. Free street parking; paid parking in T.O. Civic Arts Plaza structure. Phone: 805.557.1135. Email: info@ gardensoftheworld.info. Concerts In The Park 5 to 7 p.m. in the natural amphitheater at Conejo Community Park, 1175 Hendrix Ave., Thousand Oaks. Deadman’s Party: an Oingo Boingo Tribute performs. Bring lawn seating and picnics. $1 hot dogs and snow cones for sale. Free admission. Seating is first come, first served. On-site parking for vehicles with handicapped placards only. Do not bring pets. Web: crpd.org/concerts. MON., AUG. 15 Camarillo Optimist Club Noon to 1 p.m. at Round Table Pizza, 880 Arneill Road, by Kmart, Camarillo. Guest speaker is Kris DeVillers, PVSD assistant superintendent of curriculum, instruction and assessment. Contact: Ron Klemann. Phone: 805. 484.1343. Web: www.camarillooptimistclub.org . Conejo Valley Quilters 6:30 p.m. at Pederson Hall, Ascension Lutheran Church, 1600 E. Hillcrest Drive, Thousand Oaks. Linda W. Fisher shares a trunk show, “Quilts inspired by Gustav Klimt: The Journey of anArt Quilter.” $5 guest fee. TUES., AUG. 16 Conejo Valley Genealogical Society 6 p.m. at Grant Brimhall Library, 1401 E. Janss Road, Thousand Oaks. Surprise entertainment of a genealogical nature. Guests welcome. Contact: Priscilla. Phone: 805.390.8216. Westlake Juniors Women’s Club 6:30 to 8 p.m. at Casa Escobar, 2809 Agoura Road, Westlake Village. Wine and appetizers served. Prospective new members can meet active members and learn about club’s social and philanthropic efforts. RSVP requested. Email: . Web: westlakejuniors.org/join/ membership. WED., AUG. 17 Kiwanis Santa Susana Noon to 1:30 p.m. at Junkyard Cafe, 2825 Cochran St., Simi Valley. Discussion of community projects. Contact: Jeff. Phone: 805.377.0130. Waffle Wednesday 5 to 8 p.m. at 3625 Thousand Oaks Blvd., Thousand Oaks. Basketball games, DJ music, chicken and waffle sliders, ticket auctions. Funds go to building houses in Africa for those affected by AIDS/HIV. Admission and food free, cost to play hoops. Web: www.hoopsofhope.org . Simi Valley Democratic Club 7 p.m. at Simi Valley Town Center community room, 1555 Simi Town Center Way. Activist Richard Mathews discusses November ballot propositions. Contact: Camilla Gonzales. Phone: 805.914.9289. Conejo Valley Bonsai Society 7:30 p.m. at Westlake Village Community Center, 31200 Oak Crest Drive. Bring trees for a workshop. Phone: 805.495.7480. Soroptimist Of Oxnard 7:30 a.m. at Courtyard Marriott, 600 Esplanade Drive, Oxnard. Therapist and author Tom Prinz talks about changes. Guests asked to RSVP. Email: . Web: oxnardsoroptimist.org. FRI., AUG. 19 Ventura County Astronomical Society 7:15 p.m. at Moorpark College Forum, 7075 Campus Road. Trina Ray of JPL discusses Enceladus, Saturn’s ice moon, and presents new images from Cassini spacecraft. Free admission. Web: www.vcas.org . ‘Love Me Tender’ 8 p.m. at Malibu Creek State Park, 1925 Las Virgenes Road, Calabasas. Outdoor screening in amphitheater of Elvis’ first movie in park where it was filmed. Bring camp chair or cushion for seating and flashlight. Parking: $3 per hour or $12 all day. Email: .
